greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Neighbor in 2-1 direction of numbers arranged as clockwise spiral.
comment: Any offset (x,y) in this spiral is a permutation of the natural numbers.
link: Peter Kagey, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
Frank Ellermann, Some EIS sequences based on a spiral of natural numbers.
Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers.
example: For example, if the spiral is oriented such that 1 is immediately to the left of 2, as shown below, then a(1) = 6 because 6 is immediately to the left of 1.
results.author: _Frank Ellermann_, Feb 22 2002
